extendedIngredients.name: cod fish fillets
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 lbs sole or cod fish fillets

extendedIngredients.name: fresh coriander
extendedIngredients.original: 2 Tbsps chopped fresh coriander or parsley

extendedIngredients.name: hoisin sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 2 Tbsps black bean garlic sauce or hoisin sauce
extendedIngredients.originalName: black bean garlic sauce or hoisin sauce

title: Roasted Sole Fillets
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Roasted Sole Fillets a try. This recipe makes 1 servings with 645 calories, 123g of protein, and 6g of fat each. For $11.31 per serving, this recipe covers 42% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 25 minutes. If you have cod fish fillets, coriander, green onions, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. With a spoonacular score of 85%, this dish is awesome. Try Roasted Sole Fillets, Almond Sole Fillets, and Baked Sole Fillets for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Thrive Pinot Grigio with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 15 dollars per bottle.

instructions: Arrange fish on foil lined greased rimmed baking sheet.Stir together coriander black bean and garlic sauce and garlic.Spoon over fish.Roast in 450f degree oven until fish flakes easily when tested, 12 to 15 minutes.Serve sprinkled with green onions.

steps.step: Arrange fish on foil lined greased rimmed baking sheet.Stir together coriander black bean and garlic sauce and garlic.Spoon over fish.Roast in 450f degree oven until fish flakes easily when tested, 12 to 15 minutes.
